title: Sickening moment cruel thugs douse rabbit in alcohol and hurl it in the air
text:
Disturbing video has emerged showing a group of young men laughing as they douse a rabbit in alcohol and throw its limp body into the air.

The disturbing footage, shared on social media on Saturday night and seen by Nine News, shows people tossing around the rabbit on a rural property near Waroona, south of Perth.

The group are filmed shaking the rabbit, shouting, pouring alcohol over it and kicking it around like a football as others watch on and cheer.

A disturbing video of apparent animal cruelty was shared to social media showing a group of young men douse a rabbit in alcohol and physically abusing it before throwing it into the air.

The group of youths can be heard laughing as others continue to abuse the animal.

Eventually one of the men is then seen hurling the rabbit as far as he can by its neck.

After sparking outrage online, a number of those involved deleted their social media accounts.

Josiah Peck said he was one of the people who filmed the incident but insisted the rabbit was dead when they found it.

He also said he wanted to sincerely apologise for standing aside and filming the incident saying he made a drunken 'mistake'.

Under the Western Australian Animal Welfare Act 2002, being found guilty of animal cruelty carries a maximum penalty of a $27,500 fine or a $5,500 fine with a six-month jail term.
description: The disturbing footage, shared on social media on Saturday night, shows people tossing around the rabbit on a rural property near Waroona, south of Perth.
authors: Adam Mccleery For Daily Mail Australia
